s5876: The Grand Historian says: The Confucians sever their meanings, the galloping explainers gallop with their words, they do not strive to comprehensively grasp beginning and end;
s5877: The calendar makers take their years and months, several schools exalt divine destiny, the chronological records and secret accounts only record posthumous titles, their words are concise, but to view the essentials comprehensively is difficult.
s5878: Therefore I have calendared the twelve feudal lords, from the Gonghe administration until Confucius, making manifest in tables the great outlines of rise and decline criticized by Spring and Autumn Annals and Discourses of the States scholars, written in this chapter as a key summary for those who study and treat ancient texts.
